alert.note: Alert for Benewah; Latah; Lewis; Nez Perce; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 6:46PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Strong and wet Thunderstorms have developed in northeast Oregon and southeast Washington this afternoon, and these storms will move into the southern Idaho Panhandle later this evening. Storms will be moving quickly so keep an eye out of rapidly changing sky conditions in these areas. Brief heavy rain can cause flooding issues quickly. Watch out of lightning and strong winds along with these thunderstorms. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall due to thunderstorms is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Latah, Lewis, Nez Perce and Shoshone. Portions of Southeast Washington, including the following counties, Asotin, Garfield and Whitman. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...2021 burnscars of Lick Creek near Peola, Washington, Snake River Complex and Bedrock north of Lenore, Idaho will be susceptible to rapid runoff if thunderstorms track over the burn areas. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain potential from thunderstorms is forecast to track in the watch area. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood https://www.weather.gov/spokane
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Benewah; Latah; Lewis; Nez Perce; Shoshone
